unnormalised: New Delhi – Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) announced a significant expansion of its Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) network across Uttar Pradesh and Bihar this week. The initiative aims to connect over 50,000 new households by Q4 2024, bringing high-speed internet access to underserved areas.
normalised: New Delhi – Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (B S N L) announced a significant expansion of its Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) network across Uttar Pradesh and Bihar this week. The initiative aims to connect over fifty thousand new households by Q four two thousand and twenty four, bringing high-speed internet access to underserved areas.

unnormalised: Speaking at a press conference, Dr. Meena Sharma, BSNL’s regional director, highlighted the project's impact on education and economic development. "Reliable internet connectivity is crucial in today’s digital age. This FTTH expansion will empower students, entrepreneurs, and citizens alike."
normalised: Speaking at a press conference, Doctor Meena Sharma, B S N L’s regional director, highlighted the project's impact on education and economic development. "Reliable internet connectivity is crucial in today’s digital age. This F T T H expansion will empower students, entrepreneurs, and citizens alike."

unnormalised: The project involves laying over 1500 km of optical fiber cable and establishing new Points of Presence (PoPs) in key locations. The estimated investment is Rs. 250 Crores, funded through a combination of internal resources and government grants. Furthermore, BSNL is partnering with local ISPs to provide tailored packages, including triple-play services (internet, TV, and phone), to suit diverse customer needs. Packages start from Rs. 499 per month for 30 Mbps speed, and some even include bundled OTT subscriptions. Local kirana stores are being empowered to act as customer service touchpoints. The average Indian household subscribing can now access speeds necessary for smart home applications, with potential to support over 1200 sq ft of coverage with seamless connectivity.
